page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: Farming occupies quite a large proportion of our D. block. The names of some farms are Dunkirk or Hankey's farm, Longacre, Ouston Bank farm and Riding Farm. The soil is mostly glacial drift with poor drainage but in general is quite fertile. Nearly all the farmland has been affected at some time by mining, open cast, clay pits and subsidence. Crops grown include potatoes, swede, wheat, barley, kale, intensive grassland and recently oil seed rape. Most farms are mixed and have beef cattle, some pigs and sheep. Long Acre farm used to have 1OO British Friesian cows but they became ill possibly as a result of pollution from a chemical works nearby. Ouston Bank specializes in top quality bulls. Farming on the urban fringe has problems eg. vandalism, litter pollution nois and trespassers.
